Reviews.Title: “Pretty average, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, a very short walk from the main shopping area and the beach. Plus the ADO station is just round the corner, which is great for buses to/from other cities or from Cancun airport. The building is very nice and it's pleasant being down by the pool. The pool itself is small, but it's still good enough for a quick dip if you're hot. The water is, however, rather cold. We got one of the cheap rooms online, and as was perhaps to be expected, it certainly wasn't the best room in the place. Being on the ground floor, it had no natural light, so was rather dingy. I imagine the rooms on other floors would be brighter at least, though I think they cost more. The toilet seat was missing when we arrived, but a workman replaced it. The staff were friendly and helpful, but one thing they weren't able to help with was the internet. Wifi was available on the first night, but went down the next morning and didn't return for the duration of our stay. It was very frustrating, for we had things to organise online and therefore had to go to an internet cafe. Before the internet went down we had to to outside to use it, despite our room being off the courtyard. If you get a good deal for this hotel online it's worth staying here, but don't expect the Hilton, or a stable internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Go g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by fifth avenue which has tons of silver to buy, currency exchanges, and restaurants. It is the tourist section of downtown. This hotel is decent for the money with friendly staff. However, you have to be a traveler that is ok with some must and a little dirt to feel somewhat at home. The location is wonderful because it is a block and a half to the beach and one block from the ADO bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Aceptable!”
Reviews.Author: Edgardmx
Reviews.Content: At the beginning i wasn't too sure about reserving this hotel but because of its location i decided to stay there, its 2 blocks away from the beach, one fron the ADO station and 3 from the pick up place for my tours. I liked the design, and the services are ok, but unfortunately the lobby was under maintenance and it got a little noisy at some times. besides the small pool was in front of the workers so, it wasn't too comfortable to get in it! The price was ok, not too expensive, but not cheap, and as they don't have restaurant, you can ask for a pass to the beach club that is 5 minutes away. I would recomend this hotel if you are planning a short stay in Playa and are not planning to be long hours at the Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “OK For A Last Minute Reservation”
Reviews.Author: IlovebelizeCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK for a last minute reservation. By this I mean, as long as you are absolutely sure that you do not have to cancel or if you need a place to stay for a night or two this is convenient to the local bus terminals in Playa del Carmen and 5th Avenue. The accommodation is adequate though a bit noisy. The biggest problems I have had has been with the management nickeling and diming you to death. If you need to cancel, BEWARE! It took me over four months to get “some” of the money back that I paid up front to confirm a room. They assured me upon booking that I could cancel if necessary. I cancelled five months prior to my booking. I never did get all the money back that I had paid to Encanto Resorts. In order to get what I did back, it took daily emails / phone calls for weeks on end. I have currently given up trying to get the rest of my money back; a lesson learned and one that I will share with Trip Advisor and other travelers. Happy Travelling!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we came back”
Reviews.Author: crawley20
Reviews.Content: Last year we fell in love with Hacienda del Caribe, so when we started talking about another trip to Playa del Carmen, we knew we were going to stay here again. Although Hacienda del Caribe is not directly on the beach, it is only a one block walk to the clear, warm, gentle waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Since summer is pretty much off season, our room was only $50 USD, the same price we paid last year. We had a very spacious room with a king size bed and a balcony. The whole hotel is kept spotless. The staff is very friendly and even said they were happy to listen to my pitiful attempts at Spanish. The courtyard with the small pool is a perfect spot to relax after a day on the beach. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but it is on 2nd Street a few steps back from Avenida Cinco where you will find lots of restaurants and bars. If you should happen to be on a tight budget like we were, just wander away from Avenida Cinco to 10th Ave. or 15th Ave. and you will find a variety of good restaurants where you can eat for $5 or $6 per person. We will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just Basics - and Clean”
Reviews.Author: surfcali
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Hotel Hacienda del Caribe. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is about 1 block from the main street 5th Ave - on 2nd Street Norte. It is 1 block away from the ADO bus station ($11.00 to airport) and 4 blocks to the Cozumel ferry($15 to Cozumel). There is a small reception desk with friendly staff. They have free wifi in the main lobby and courtyard - but it is not strong enough for rooms wifi. I got a room on the 2nd floor and did not have any problem with noise. The air conditioner worked well. It had the basics and a small pool - but I did not use the pool. I spent most of my time at the beach - and also out at restaurants and cafes out on 5th Ave. Parking can be an issue in the area since it is by the ferry to Cozumel, and is a very busy area, but there are parking lots with 1 block. If you want a cheap option that is clean and comfortable and on a budget you will be happy. It is simple and a budget hotel that I would recommend to solo or couple travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, average cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: ChrisOz77
Reviews.Content: We may have just been unlucky, but had no hot water for 2 days. We were told if we wanted a hot shower we could walk 5 blocks to their sister hotel!!! Pool could do with a clean, sheets and towels had some interesting stains on them (we tried not to think too much about why...) and despite paying the hotel DIRECTLY at the time of check-in, they insisted they couldn't provide a receipt because we had (only) reserved the room via this site. Not sure if they get what a receipt actually is. Good location though (upside?).

Reviews.Title: “Clean room at a good location, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lemmora
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this hotel because it was the most affordable option for a one night stop as we headed to Calakmul. The hotel is well situated and only a few steps away from Avenida 5. We booked the room through Hotels.com and specifically requested a king size bed. Upon arrival, I was told that the only available room had two queen beds and the room was on the first floor facing the pool/lobby. This was irritating as I had called and confirmed that we would be able to get a king size bed and that our late arrival would not be a problem. Good Points: The room was very clean and fairly comfortable. This is a good option if you are looking for a clean budget hotel that is on Avenida 5. I personally wouldn’t pay more than $45 USD/room at this hotel. We paid $65 USD through hotels.com which is way more than we should have paid. The reception desk staff was polite. The lobby is cozy, nice, and comfortable with a small pool. Negative Points: There is no parking for the hotel so if you have a car it makes things more complicated as parking is difficult to find in Playa. We had to run the shower for about 15 minutes with the hot water knob turned all the way in order to get the hot water running. I would stay away from the rooms on the bottom floor facing the pool as they have huge windows facing the pool and lobby. There are curtains for privacy but you won’t have any privacy if you open your curtains. Wifi at the hotel wasn’t working while we were there so this added to the list of annoyances. Luckily we were only there for one night. I would rather pay more money and stay somewhere else next time we are in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: claireharbor
Reviews.Content: Didn't have the best first impression of this hotel. Our room was so dark (view from the window was a brick wall) and it had a damp musty smell. Next day we asked to switch rooms and they moved us to a room to doors which was much nicer. Room was big with two massive double beds, great shower and a tiny balcony by the pool, very colourfully decorated. The best thing about this was price and location (2 min to beach, bus station and shops and bars) . Bad points - pool is tiny with no sunbeds and don't bother with the breakfast. Also would recommend asking for room on 2nd/3rd floor as they seemed to have more light and be more private.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: rebecca063
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint; it has a romantic feel to it. It's nicely decorated with bright colors and tropical plants and paintings. The beds are (not overly) firm and comfortable. Rooms with out a window are a little dim but not dingy at all and, super clean. During breakfast I watched the cleaning staff wipe every crevice of the outside door. The staff was very helpful at the front desk, other staff like kitchen and cleaning were very kind and don't speak much English so a bit of made up sign language will help. There is no phone in the room, but there's wireless and a TV and an a/c that worked great. There was hot water everyday and great water pressure. The pool is very small but still saw some people go for a dip later in the evening or first thing in the morning...I personally rather the ocean which is less then half a block away(3min). This brings me to my next point location! Right on 5th and 2nd so close to the hustle and bustle on 5th and beach and bus terminal (2min walk), but just off to the side where it's quiet and you can get a good night rest. I found many inexpensive local restaurants that were not on 5th that were just as good and in most cases better and authentic...most are between 20 and 30st, ice-cream is half the price on 30th as well. Great places to eat are El Fogon for the meat lovers and for Fish try La Tarraya on the beach right at the end of the street of the hotel where 2nd and the beach meet...fish fillet with rice and salad was $5, 3 huge fish empanadas were less then $2 and the view is priceless. Only and not a big one at all i had with the hotel was the breakfast. Mine was included which was cool, it was one egg a bit of ham, toast, juice and coffee, which was great but the staff was SUPER slow...solution I went about 40min earlier then I would usually because I knew it was going to take long...just be patient...afterall your on vacation...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service during our trip and bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: modernprimitive
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Hacienda for our first night in Playa del Carmen. At first we were very pleased. We had a big clean room, a nice bathroom, a good bed and a balcony. Overall we thought to stay in a nice hotel. The location is great 5 minutes from the beach and near the tourist zone, but not directly in the 5th avenue. Unfortunately it turned out to be quit a bad place. First the pool is to small to swim (approx. 2mx1,50m) and seems more to be decoration only. Moreover it is viewable from the street. The worst thing were the bloodsucking bugs in our room. When we went to bed we spotted several of them on the wall and even 3 or 4 in the bed, one that had already sucked some blood. We complained at the reception immediately. The night boy tried to help us and gave us a new room without bugs. Unfortunately it had no windows and the room was directly connected to a second with a locked door. We heard everything from the other room and woke up early (6 a.m.). In the morning we complained again at the reception, they offered us a new room and 40% discount on our next night. The boss was called but not interested to talk to us. They were not willing to give any money back, or a free night. Additionally there was no Wifi in the rooms (both of them) only outside. All in all the Hacienda is far too expansive for what it offers, has an uncooperative management and our room had bed bugs. We changed hotel directly onto the other side of the street, it is cheaper has a better pool and clean rooms, we stayed there for the rest of the week. I wouldn't recommend the Hacienda to any traveller. Worst service ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hot-Spot”
Reviews.Author: LHME
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Short walk to beach, restaurants, hot spots, and still has a quiet peaceful atmosphere. Old style Mexican decor with all the modern ammenities. Will definately stay there when in Playa Del Carmen...worth looking into! Go to Karen's just around the corner for great food, drinks and music. Perfect for people watching as you relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: doctorpatrick
Reviews.Content: It's is really a great budget stay. Squeaky clean, almost luxurious, safe & secure, wonderfully hospitible staff and excellent location w/pool in middle of courtyard. Would be our first choice on a return visit. A travel tip: we went in the month of May which is Playa del Carmen's bargain season. However, their cut rate price was $50 USD (CASH) as were most other hotels. Believe me, if you stay here you'll be quite satisfied. BTW you can just skip Cancun and take the $10 ADO bus from the airport there which drops you off (literally) next door to the Hotel Hacienda del Caribe. Enjoy yourself and send us an email about your experience. Dr. Pat

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: crawley20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights here in May. We loved the location, about 1 block back from the beach. This is a small hotel with well appointed rooms which all look out on a courtyard which contains a small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Christina2001
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel with lovely rooms and friendly staff. The rooms were made up with towel origami on arrival - always a nice touch. The hotel is a very short stroll to the beach and only moments away from the main shopping area with restaurants and souvenir shops aplenty. Breakfast was very nice, though they do not serve lunch or dinner. The swimming pool is very small as others have noted, but when the beach is so nearby, this does not matter so much. I had a happy time at this hotel (one of 3 I stayed at while in PDC) and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: FussyCosmo
Reviews.Content: I found this place while wondering around town and checked-in for three nights. It's in a great location and has a lot of nice charm. The rooms are good but the less expensive smaller ones have limited light. However, they seem to offer them at a very good value (I paid $45USD per night). The larger rooms have small balconies and a lot more light. The pool is very refreshing and the place is clean. The towels were very scratchy and the sheets weren't great either. But overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Caribe...nice quality stay”
Reviews.Author: crystal097
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda Caribe is in a great location...close to 5th but on th side street so no noise.. we reallu enjoyed our stay. the staff are great,helpful and very friendly. it is a perfectlittle oasis with the court yard and being so close to 5th. we didnèt stay for breakfast since we headed to 5th to eat at the varity of places. anyhow would recommend. Our room was clean, and we loved the Mxican tile and layout.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and nice”
Reviews.Author: no_boat-the_pirate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the master suite and found it clean, big and wonderful. Our balcony overlooked the street and we could see the ocean from it. The staff was friendly and helpful, the price was excellent, breakfast was good and the location was great. We arrived early and they let us check in early. I would not stay here for a week because I like to "get away" from the city but I really enjoyed the hotel. I read some of the other reviews and our room and bath were clean and smelled clean and we had hot water that was hot. I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but good location”
Reviews.Author: jpk35
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed a week in Akumal and wanted one night in Playa before flying out of Cancun. They promised us a crib for our 2 year old and then claimed to have no idea what we were talking about and we speak fluent spanish. The rooms were decent, but I agree that the lighting is horrible. Overall it was clean, but my son found a condom wrapper on the floor under the bed.....gross. The location, however, is fantastic and we were just there one night and had a wonderful time walking up and down the avenida.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Location”
Reviews.Author: NJCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid April and were very happy with experience. The hotel is colorful and has interesting architecture. As we stood on the balcony many people walking past stopped to look at it and took pictures. The rooms were kept clean altho they are a little dark and somewhat musty. Lots of tile and decoration. The courtyard is nice but shades the small pool so no place to sunbathe on premises. Breakfast is provided and is adequate but nothing special. Staff was pleasant and helpful. They gave us good info on reataurants and arranged rides and outings. Be aware that every reference is accompanied by a kickback based on what we saw. Our most enjoyable day was spent on an arranged trip to Tuleum and then a trip south to a beach called Paradiso. There can be no more beautiful place on earth. The hotel is in a good location directly up from what is probably the best part of the Playa beach. It is near the bus depot which is a transporation choice we never really thought about until seeing it. The last 2 blocks to the beach are closed to traffic so you will be dropped off and have to hike your luggage to all hotels. Saw many people slogging their stuff with surprised and dismayed look on their face. This hotel only half block from drop off. Stayed a week and had great meals every nite on Calle N 5 strip. Some bargains for lunch but prices are comparable to U.S. You can have low key nite or party at some of the outdoor bars till 4AM. Overall a wonderful week. Loved Playa, the beach and would return again. Based on price, location and character would also return to Hacienda del Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “hacienday del caribe-simple, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: misspiggy1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hacienda del caribe for one week (2/11/07-2/18/07. all the decor is Diego Rivera style. the room was quiet and clean. the people working there were nice. this was an economical choice ($588 for the week, including taxes), and fit our needs. the hot water was not HOT. but it was ok. the lights were dim, but we were in our room only to sleep, shower, and change clothes. the location was good: 1/2 block from 5th Avenue and 1 block more to the beach. we loved Playa del Carmen and would go back there and to Hacienda in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: C&L23
Reviews.Content: Like most things in Playa, this hotel is a bit overpriced for what you get. The rooms are clean but extremely dark. Honestly, it was diffcult to sift through my suitcase, even during the day. Some noise problems but not too bad b/c the hotel is about a block from 5th Ave -- where most of the restaurants and bars are. Walk to the beach is about 2 blocks. Tip: the white "colectivo" vans that run up and down the main highway for only 25 pesos are just a block away in the opposite direction as the beach. I'd probably stay here again, but I'd specifically ask for a room with better lighting + a room not/not on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “What Charm!”
Reviews.Author: Streich3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Del Caribe for 1 night in February 07 prior to our 6 night stay at the Azul Beach Hotel. While they are 2 totally different kinds of places, the Hacienda reflects my earthy side wanting to get to know the culture, people, food and architecture. If all you want to do is go to Mexico, lay on the beach and not experience the culture, this would not be the place for you. However, we LOVED it! It is probably the most beautiful hotel in all of Playa del Carmen (as we checked out many of the others and they looked kind of dumpy). It is very colorful, filled with handpainted mexican tile as well as hanging plants throughout. We stayed in a Queen sized suite which was HUGE. It had 2 queen size beds, a large sitting area with 2 sofas, a table and chairs as well as a mini fridge. It also had a large balcony with an ocean view. It's located only 1 block from the beach down Calle 2, which from what we could tell was the nicest part of the Playa del Carmen beach. There at the end of the street at another hotel/restaurant we rented 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella for only $10 for the entire day. The waiter was very attentive and was contstantly checking to see if there was anything we needed. My 3 year old son had a great time playing in the sand and swimming. Later that day we enjoyed walking down Avenida 5 where all the shops and restaurants are located. We immediately fell in love with Playa del Carmen. Our only regret is that we didn't stay at the Hacienda longer. But we did go back to visit Playa del Carmen later that week because we loved the ambience so much with the wonderful people, shops and restaurants. Since parking is at a premium in Playa del Carmen and we had a car, luckily there is a parking lot right across the street from the hotel. The hotel staff was friendly, the room was clean and bright. The beds are a little firm, but we like our beds firm. I've attached a picture of a shop across the street from the hotel where I took a picture of my son with a monkey and a street shot of Avenida 5 where all the shops and restaurants are located. I didn't include pictures of the hotel as their website pictures more than do it justice. We had a wonderful italian meal at Ristaurante Bruno. It was a wonderful cultural experience and we would definitely return to the Hacienda for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: jackcd
Reviews.Content: we were on a tour and they put us ther for two nights. the first room did not have a window so we changed rooms. the second room had a window on the courtyard and was also dark with 25 watt bulbs so we couldnt read. there were no dresser drawers so we had no place to put our clothes. also no place to hang clothes. no chairs in the room or elevator. there was an old women cooking breakfast and i was not comfortable with the cleanliness. one afternoon there was no hot water. the pool is in the courtyard and probably 10 by 15 ft. little sun in the courtyard. it was however close to the main street and beach

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambience and location”
Reviews.Author: mysticbubbles
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a economical, 3-plus star hotel which would give us a sample of the local mexican culture in playa del carmen area. We found the pictures of this hotel impressive and the manager gave us a good deal on the room rate considering it was super high season (first week of Jan). We loved the suite on the second floor with 2 king beds. The room was clean, spacious, with quaint furniture and a balcony overlooking the street with partial view of the ocean at one end. It was just what we wanted, our 2 young kids had enough room to walk around and we were able to soak in some local color from the balcony not to mention sunrise and sunsets over the ocean. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Although the breakfast leaves much to be desired in terms of variety and cleanliness. Thats why we give it 4 stars. The pool is small, but with the amount of water activity outdoors we really didn't need it. Clean towels everyday and clean rooms when we got back, can't complain. Plus a safe, fridge, and tv with cartoons (albeit in spanish, kids didn't mind). Will go back. Nice restaurants too just around the corner. Negatives no elevators but stairs were not too bad. Good place for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: We stumbled across Hotel Hacienda del Caribe having initially checked in (and paid!) at another hotel around the corner which was a total dive. This hotel though, is not dive like, it's excellent and was really good value at US$56 per night (including tax) for a large room with a king bed. There isn't a refrigerator which was disappointing, but for all around good value for money, this place wins hands down. The staff were friendly, although their English wasn't good and the sheets were changed daily with lovely towel arrangements (swans etc) left on our bed. The location is good and most things you need will be only a 5, or 10 min walk away. Definitely good value and if I'm ever in Playa del Carmen again, I'd have no hesitation staying here.

Reviews.Title: “How could you ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: TheCanucks
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit to Playa but our first stay at the Hacienda del Caribe, and we enjoyed it very much. The hotel was very clean and although the staff didn't speak the best english they were always very friendly. It was within a block of the beach and you could easily walk to anything you wanted to see on the strip. I would deffinately recommend checking this place out. The pool was awsome and the courtyard was beautifull. Very Mexican ,very clean, very cool, can't wait till next year.
